dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, Canada is now the absolute worst country for digital nomads, according to this new index.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Canada is now the absolute worst country for digital nomads, according to this new index.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's pretty surprising, right? I mean, it's home to major tech hubs, but apparently the internet speeds are slow and remote job searches are just not happening there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's pretty surprising, right? I mean, it's home to major tech hubs, but apparently the internet speeds are slow and remote job searches are just not happening there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home to one of the largest tech hubs in the world it scores well across the board, from fast internet speeds to a top ten ranking on the Global Happiness Index and by far the most remote job search returns in the top ten.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they mentioned the Global Happiness Index ranking is extremely low too—like, people aren't happy there either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they mentioned the Global Happiness Index ranking is extremely low too-like, people aren't happy there either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home to one of the largest tech hubs in the world it scores well across the board, from fast internet speeds to a top ten ranking on the Global Happiness Index and by far the most remote job search returns in the top ten.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how the index even includes things like rental prices and wifi speed now, which totally makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how the index even includes things like rental prices and wifi speed now, which totally makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With that in mind Circle Loop has done the legwork for you, taking in a range of factors from the price and speed of net connections to rental prices and remote job searches.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then you've got the UK as the top country to move to? That feels counterintuitive with all their cost of living issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then you've got the U K as the top country to move to? That feels counterintuitive with all their cost of living issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Somewhat surprisingly considering the current turmoil of Brexit, the UK is the runner up thanks to the volume of remote jobs available coupled with a high standard of living.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Like, high living costs and poor standard of living—why would anyone choose that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Like, high living costs and poor standard of living-why would anyone choose that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Somewhat surprisingly considering the current turmoil of Brexit, the UK is the runner up thanks to the volume of remote jobs available coupled with a high standard of living.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And North Korea in third place? That's gotta be a joke or something—increased quality of life for foreigners?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And North Korea in third place? That's gotta be a joke or something-increased quality of life for foreigners?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third place goes to Romania a country Id wager isnt on most peoples digital nomad radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it sounds totally bizarre. But the index says it's a great marriage of opportunity and low living costs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it sounds totally bizarre. But the index says it's a great marriage of opportunity and low living costs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as one of the fastest growing information technology markets in Central and Eastern Europe, its a great marriage of opportunity and fantastically low living costs super fast fixed line broadband packages cost around $8 a month!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, I can't imagine many digital nomads are actually flocking to North Korea.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, I can't imagine many digital nomads are actually flocking to North Korea.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. And then Argentina rounds out the top ten worst, so it's mostly non-European countries on this list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. And then Argentina rounds out the top ten worst, so it's mostly non-European countries on this list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Digital Nomad Index top ten features eight European countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because a lot of people used to think of places like Bali or Thailand as nomad hotspots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because a lot of people used to think of places like Bali or Thailand as nomad hotspots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but with travel restrictions and revoked working holiday visas, it's just not the same landscape anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but with travel restrictions and revoked working holiday visas, it's just not the same landscape anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response to the increased need to work from home many countries have introduced working holiday visas to encourage a new form of tourism to boost their badly affected coffers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, countries are really pushing to boost their local economies instead of encouraging nomad tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, countries are really pushing to boost their local economies instead of encouraging nomad tourism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response to the increased need to work from home many countries have introduced working holiday visas to encourage a new form of tourism to boost their badly affected coffers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like the golden age of digital nomadism might be over, at least for now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like the golden age of digital nomadism might be over, at least for now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With vaccinations starting to roll out globally and hopes of more freedom of movement coming soon, theres never been a better time to embrace life as a digital nomad to continue working remotely but combine it with travel (to the places and at the times its safe to do so), new experiences and a complete change of lifestyle.

artist_script:
HostA: So, Canada is now the absolute worst country for digital nomads, according to this new index.
HostB: Yeah, that’s pretty surprising, right? I mean, it’s home to major tech hubs, but apparently the internet speeds are slow and remote job searches are just not happening there.
HostA: And they mentioned the Global Happiness Index ranking is extremely low too—like, people aren’t happy there either.
HostB: It’s wild how the index even includes things like rental prices and wifi speed now, which totally makes sense.
HostA: Exactly! And then you’ve got the UK as the top country to move to? That feels counterintuitive with all their cost of living issues.
HostB: Right? Like, high living costs and poor standard of living—why would anyone choose that?
HostA: And North Korea in third place? That’s gotta be a joke or something—increased quality of life for foreigners?
HostB: I know, it sounds totally bizarre. But the index says it’s a great marriage of opportunity and low living costs.
HostA: Still, I can’t imagine many digital nomads are actually flocking to North Korea.
HostB: No kidding. And then Argentina rounds out the top ten worst, so it’s mostly non-European countries on this list.
HostA: Which is interesting because a lot of people used to think of places like Bali or Thailand as nomad hotspots.
HostB: Yeah, but with travel restrictions and revoked working holiday visas, it’s just not the same landscape anymore.
HostA: Plus, countries are really pushing to boost their local economies instead of encouraging nomad tourism.
HostB: It’s like the golden age of digital nomadism might be over, at least for now.
HostA: Definitely feels that way.
